item.title: Research
item.description: An easy acess to published papers in ORCiD PhD project highlight I investigated the role of macromolecular crowding (confinement effects) In the budding yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae during stress episodes such as osmotic stress and nutrient starvation. To monitor crowding in the cell I used a combination of molecular biosensors (FRET technology), confocal and Slimfield super-resolution light microscopy technique as physical tools. I optimised a cellular model with yeast strains engineered for the controlled expression of trackable (down to single molecule level) fluorescently tagged cytoplasmic aggregates.
